intro: I'm that one guy all software developers hate, mostly because I can effortlessly break any program.

post.body:
test
hmmm, zerome treats newlines interestingly...

@kaffie: I did my best!
I also failed miserably
why does everyone feel the need to add an extra n in my name ;-;

I wish I knew more people who use zeronet, it makes a world of difference when the router craps out and you get 2k+ ping

so, anyone else awake?
does anyone follow me at all?

internet crapped itself two days in a row!
that hasn't happened before...

what programming languages do you all like and use?
or just tell me about the worlds worst programming language ever.

personally I've learned some C and C# through schooling, and I'm looking into rust since that looks like a nice "upgrade" from C.
that being said I still love C for some reason even though I never use it for x86 development.
just got zeronet set up on my desktop again, setting it up as a package in opensuse was more of a hassle than I expected.
it would seem zeronet on my desktop is somewhat broken..

well, it took a while, but I guess I have arch on my desktop again now...
opensuse didn't really work out for me

what do you people think of an "official" discord server for zeronet users?
Seems quite backwards to me, but maybe it's worthwhile?
I'm asking since a friend said he felt that zeronet needs one
boop
ok, so I can't view @kaffie: 's messages. I think kaffiehub is what broke my zerome, but I'll have to do some more testing.

somehow fixed an issue I had with kaffiehub not syncing by running "chown -R zeronet:zeronet data"
what the fuck
living in a city makes focusing on anything incredibly difficult

I now have a blog 
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1JKxHCTNCvGwAb3cweic7qNoRzqWerjFLn
I feel like there's a lot more new zeronet users coming in now compared to a few days ago, just me?

how is the process of getting a domain on zeronet?
cc: @kaffie:

interesting, to fix zeronet sync issues I've made this script so far
systemctl stop zeronet
chown -R zeronet:zeronet /var/lib/zeronet/*
systemctl start zeronet

stolen from @ulrichard: How To Stop Girls From Kissing The Mirror In School
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BGOHGpMKFew

I feel like  not a lot has happened on zerome hmmm,
lots of new people constantly streaming in though, which is nice.
now looking for a jolla phone *again* and none of them seem to be on the market :/
I installed void linux on my laptop today, it boots faster than any other OS I've ever used, and is fairly easy to manage. It's definitely meant for veterans though

payday 2 is currently free on steam! Grab it while you can! (you receive a permanent copy not sure what the timelimit is)

can't hurt right?
test post to check for internet

zeromusic is by far the best experience I've had when it comes to finding *new* music tbh

all other services just promote garbage

comment.body: sounds like you had a lot of fun lol
if you hit enter in a reply it just goes ahead and posts, but when you're making a new post it handles them properly..
that's actually pretty annoying.
I know that feel yo
wow, congrats. And god damn it now there is one less girl I'd consider dating in the world :v
for some reason I find  having a season as your name weird, same thing with someone I were in class with called august
you can literally see where my browser crashed
@Kaffie: well, at least I'm in it now :v

@Kaffie: I'm honored :D
@Thegillies: yeah, I posted that at midnight :v
@Border0464fred: that sucks, know your pain though, used to work on a boat. At least it had internet
@Border0464fred: haha, yeah. Reception near land isn't too bad, but when you're going a few miles out it's not the greatest.
*sigh* my spelling seems to be degrading by the minute...

there isn't a whole lot of activity here to begin with, with only like 2000 people on zeronet in total? :P
congrats though!

@Kaffie: what's your favourite paradigm then? OOP?
Personally I find that OOP makes me do tedious tasks that I shouldn't have to do.
@Kaffie: yeah, for the most part I see somewhere between 500 and 1000 users online, so I figure there's probably not a whole lot more than 1500 users in total :p

@Styromaniac: maybe we can make a chrome extension that connects to zeronet, so that people won't have to install a program.
Also has the bonus of working with chromeOS, which would be nice I guess
@Styromaniac: fixing the mobile experience would be up to the zite owners themselves, so there's not much I or any other single person can do about that
@Styromaniac: perhaps it would be a good idea to have a mobile version of zerohello instead, I don't see a way of making it mobile friendly without kneecapping the desktop version.
might try to make it one of those oneclick things tomorrow

@Seequ: oh, and for future reference, please use the edit feature instead of posting several time, while editing newlines are added instead of posting when you hit enter.
and we won't see 4 posts when it should've been 1 or 2 :p
